item.title: Heather's Mum add a quote by Carl Sagan
item.description: "It pays to keep an open mind, but not so open your brains fall out." -- Carl Sagan

item.title: Heather's Mum add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "I am enough of an artist to draw freely upon my imagination. Imagination is more important than knowledge. Knowledge is limited. Imagination encircles the world." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Heather's Mum add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description:
"Never put off till tomorrow what may be done day after tomorrow just as well".
From: "More Maxims of Mark" -- Mark Twain

item.title: Heather's Mum add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Only dull people are brilliant at breakfast." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Heather's Mum add a quote by Robin Williams
item.description: "See, the problem is that God gives men a brain and a penis, and only enough blood to run one at a time." -- Robin Williams

item.title: Heather's Mum add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "No one who can read, ever looks at a book, even unopened on a shelf, like one who cannot." -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Heather's Mum add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Heather's Mum add a quote by mark twain
item.description: "Reader, suppose you were an idiot. And suppose you were a member of Congress. But I repeat myself." -- mark twain

item.title: Heather's Mum add a quote by Steve Martin
item.description: "You know that look that women get when they want to have sex? Me neither." -- Steve Martin

item.title: Heather's Mum add a quote by Steve Martin
item.description: "First the doctor told me the good news: I was going to have a disease named after me." -- Steve Martin

item.title: Heather's Mum add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "There is a wisdom of the head, and... there is a wisdom of the heart." -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Heather's Mum add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Whoever is careless with the truth in small matters cannot be trusted with important matters" -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Heather's Mum add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Women and cats will do as they please, and men and dogs should relax and get used to the idea." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Heather's Mum add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Everything must be made as simple as possible. But not simpler." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Heather's Mum add a quote by Steve Martin
item.description: "I like a woman with a head on her shoulders. I hate necks." -- Steve Martin

item.title: Heather's Mum add a quote by Galileo Galilei
item.description: "I have never met a man so ignorant that I couldn't learn something from him." -- Galileo Galilei

item.title: Heather's Mum add a quote by Lily Tomlin
item.description: "The trouble with being in the rat race is that even if you win, you're still a rat." -- Lily Tomlin

item.title: Heather's Mum add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "It is a pleasant world we live in, sir, a very pleasant world. There are bad people in it, Mr. Richard, but if there were no bad people, there would be no good lawyers." -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Heather's Mum add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "It was the best of times, it was the worst of times." -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Heather's Mum add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "Beauty is only skin deep, but ugly goes clean to the bone." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Heather's Mum add a quote by charles dickens
item.description: "To conceal anything from those to whom I am attached, is not in my nature. I can never close my lips where I have opened my heart." -- charles dickens

item.title: Heather's Mum add a quote by Carl Sagan
item.description: "But I could be wrong." -- Carl Sagan

item.title: Heather's Mum add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Heather's Mum add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "My concern is not whether God is on our side; my greatest concern is to be on God's side, for God is always right." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Heather's Mum add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Time is a drug. Too much of it kills you." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Heather's Mum add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Heather's Mum add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "I must have a prodigious amount of mind; it takes me as much as a week, sometimes, to make it up!" -- Mark Twain

item.title: Heather's Mum add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "If writers wrote as carelessly as some people talk, then adhasdh asdglaseuyt[bn[ pasdlgkhasdfasdf." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Heather's Mum add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "Have a heart that never hardens, and a temper that never tires, and a touch that never hurts." -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Heather's Mum add a quote by George F. Will
item.description: "The nice part about being a pessimist is that you are constantly being either proven right or pleasantly surprised." -- George F. Will
